item.name: Cutting Greatsword
item.text:
Damage from this sword is psychic damage instead of the weapon's usual damage type. A creature damaged by this sword must make a DC 12 wisdom saving throw or suffer 1 random type of short term madness until the end of the target's next turn.
Heavy: Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Proficiency: martial, greatsword Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 52 (Homebrew), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149

item.name: Cutting Longsword
item.text:
Damage from this sword is psychic damage instead of the weapon's usual damage type. A creature damaged by this sword must make a DC 12 wisdom saving throw or suffer 1 random type of short term madness until the end of the target's next turn.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Proficiency: martial, longsword Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 52 (Homebrew), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149

item.name: Cutting Rapier
item.text:
Damage from this sword is psychic damage instead of the weapon's usual damage type. A creature damaged by this sword must make a DC 12 wisdom saving throw or suffer 1 random type of short term madness until the end of the target's next turn.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Proficiency: martial, rapier Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 52 (Homebrew), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149

item.name: Steeleaf Greatsword
item.text:
The blade of this weapon is made from steeleaf, a magical material from the feywild. Grown on special trees, it is as light as a leaf but as sharp as steel. This weapon has the finesse property, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Attacking with this weapon while hidden does not reveal your position if the attack misses.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Heavy: Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Proficiency: martial, greatsword Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 55 (Homebrew), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149
